answers.answer: it is possible - it is more common in first pregnancies.
Yes I started showing signs of it in my first pregnancy and didn't have issues with it my second or third.
I had it severely in my first. Have been on meds since 6wks with this one and so far so good!

Thank you. Been trying not to worry. I seen much healthier this time and I've been exercising and drinking water and generally taking better care of myself this time. Just don't want another preterm induction. I had NO control over anything last time and was so sick I thought I was dying. Just needed to hear that it can be done I guess.
Can anyone answer the same question for gestational diabetes???

How far along do you typically start showing signs of preeclampsia? I've been having a really rough pregnancy and am already high risk and I just have this gut feeling something else is going to happen before its all over...I'm trying not to stress it though...lol

@aruth I became unwell at 20wks and it went from hypertension to preeclamplsia at 28wks, delivered by csection at 35wks to save our lives. @ Krystika I haven't had gd before so can't help there sorry.
With my daughter I was 33 weeks and they said I wouldn't go home till I had a baby. I had to wait 2 weeks until she arrived.
I had gd with my 2nd pregnancy. But not with my 1st and I'm 30 wks with my 3rd and no signs of gd so far

question: to have preeclampsia with first pregnancy and be OK with second one? Anyone have a healthy pregnancy after dealing with it first time?
title: is it possible...
